text: In this video, we will show you

how to unlock your iPhone
using only your voice.
This method of unlocking may not be
as secure as other methods.
In a test, we were able to have
another person other than ourselves
use their voice to unlock the phone,
so use this method cautiously.

First, open settings
and tap "Accessibility."
Scroll down and tap "Voice Control."

Make sure the voice control
toggle is turned on.
Tap "Customize Commands,"
and then tap "Create New Command"
and type in the phrase you'd like to use
to unlock your phone.
We will use the command "open phone."
Tap "Action," then "Run Custom Gesture."
This gesture screen will not show you

where your passcode
numbers are on the screen.

You will have to know exactly
where these numbers are
ahead of time to input the gesture.
Once set, tap "Save"
and exit settings.
Now, while locked, your phone should open
to the voice command phrase you set.
Open phone.
